channel.title: Weird problem with linux
channel.description: In every linux distro, sometimes the screen seems to freeze with the screen being a color like blue, and some weird pattern in it. I think it is because of my nvidia graphics card. Is there any solution to this or do I have to live with it?

item.title: Weird problem with linux
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Strange. What is your mother board?

Read full topic

item.title: Weird problem with linux
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:45, topic:246987”][quote author=chrisn2323 link=topic=325940.msg2619510#msg2619510 date=1231278957]

seven quad core processors wouldn’t work, you’d need eight.

Why?

I’m pretty sure adamp1245234627 meant seven computers with quad core processors per household.

lunix is fun for a while till you realize nothing works well.

omg winblows, well I can say linsucks

With nothing, do you mean yourself?

I like how you have no counter argument to what I said. So you say some shitty insult.

Linux is slow to offer compatibility for new hardware. For example there isn’t a stable driver for my 9600gt

Ubuntu is slow as fuck and on my other computer it constantly lagged

I installed firefox in arch and then went to install the flash plugin. The plugin installed but firefox wouldn’t display flash objects. I later realized that the firefox folder was installed as read only.

The arch cd wont even boot on an amd 64 6000+ (which has been out for a while) and hangs on some slub message.
[/quote]
It is your mobo that does that. Just go into the BIOS and disable Cool’n’Quiet mode.[/quote]
orly, lol thanks

apparently cool’n’quiet also fuks with overclocking also.

Read full topic

item.title: Weird problem with linux
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:32, topic:246987”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=325940.msg2619177#msg2619177 date=1231265514]

seven quad core processors wouldn’t work, you’d need eight.

Why?

I’m pretty sure adamp1245234627 meant seven computers with quad core processors per household.

lunix is fun for a while till you realize nothing works well.

omg winblows, well I can say linsucks

With nothing, do you mean yourself?
[/quote]
I like how you have no counter argument to what I said. So you say some shitty insult.

Linux is slow to offer compatibility for new hardware. For example there isn’t a stable driver for my 9600gt

Ubuntu is slow as fuck and on my other computer it constantly lagged

I installed firefox in arch and then went to install the flash plugin. The plugin installed but firefox wouldn’t display flash objects. I later realized that the firefox folder was installed as read only.

The arch cd wont even boot on an amd 64 6000+ (which has been out for a while) and hangs on some slub message.[/quote]
It is your mobo that does that. Just go into the BIOS and disable Cool’n’Quiet mode.

Read full topic

item.title: Weird problem with linux
item.dc:creator: @adamp40 adamp40
item.description:
@adamp40 wrote:

chrisn2323:

Linux is slow to offer compatibility for new hardware.

Thats why theres a Project called “ReactOS” which provides an Open Source OS that runs from the Windows NT Kernel but is legal!

Tbh me, runescape3dude and Morparisthebest are the only people here that actualy gave an answer to the Quesion :s

Read full topic

item.title: Weird problem with linux
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

chrisn2323:

Linux is slow to offer compatibility for new hardware. For example there isn’t a stable driver for my 9600gt

What you actually meant here was “Nvidia are too slow to offer linux drivers for new hardware”.

I have no idea if that’s true or not, just pointing out that your problem is Nvidias fault.

Read full topic

item.title: Weird problem with linux
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:31, topic:246987”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=325940.msg2617810#msg2617810 date=1231161451]

seven quad core processors wouldn’t work, you’d need eight.

Why?
[/quote]

I’m pretty sure adamp1245234627 meant seven computers with quad core processors per household.

lunix is fun for a while till you realize nothing works well.

omg winblows, well I can say linsucks

With nothing, do you mean yourself?[/quote]
I like how you have no counter argument to what I said. So you say some shitty insult.

Linux is slow to offer compatibility for new hardware. For example there isn’t a stable driver for my 9600gt

Ubuntu is slow as fuck and on my other computer it constantly lagged

I installed firefox in arch and then went to install the flash plugin. The plugin installed but firefox wouldn’t display flash objects. I later realized that the firefox folder was installed as read only.

The arch cd wont even boot on an amd 64 6000+ (which has been out for a while) and hangs on some slub message.

Read full topic

Nobody uses linux anymore

Well Sorry, Snob; Not everyone can afford seven quad core computers per household.

Linux Owns all other OSes when it comes to running it on a old PC. You can easily run some Distros on a 300Mhz 64mb RAM pc while Windows is closed source, costs too much and requires a pretty good PC to run.

[/quote]

seven quad core processors wouldn’t work, you’d need eight. anyway this faget is just jealos i got vista what does he have linux 96 rofl lmao Tongue Cool winksmile shifty and btw i woudlnt take that from a junior lol Tongue.[/quote]I’m surprised you aren’t muted yet. R.I.P RSC:

Of course, if you dig deeper into Linux it’ll become harder to understand what you are doing, but you can’t dig that deep in Windows.

You cant dig at all in Windows.

"System32.dll Error - No digging

It is a violation of the EULA to dig
into the Windows Source code.
Windows will now shut down."
